description: Russian hackers are going after US government officials, defense workers and others in a new email phishing campaign targeting thousands of people, according to Microsoft Corp.
title: Russian Hackers Are Targeting US Officials, Microsoft Says

description: Rachel Reeves will pledge to “rebuild Britain” with her first budget, an historic moment that will include a major package of tax hikes and extra borrowing likely to define British politics for the rest of the decade.
title: Reeves to Raise Taxes to ‘Rebuild’ UK in High-Wire First Budget

description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China has made key technological advances despite the US’s effort to curb it.
title: The US Pledged to Rein in China’s Tech Ambitions. It’s Struggling

description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said global investors are overstating the risk that financial markets will be plunged into uncertainty by the lack of a clear victor soon after next week’s US presidential election.
title: Goldman Says Traders Are Too Worried About Delays to US Vote Result

description: The world outside the US is increasingly driving Chinese electric vehicles, scrolling the web on Chinese smartphones and powering their homes with Chinese solar panels.
title: US Efforts to Contain Xi's Push for Tech Supremacy Are Faltering

description: The US Supreme Court refused to order the removal of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s name from presidential election ballots in Michigan and Wisconsin, rejecting a pair of last-ditch requests from the onetime candidate.
title: Supreme Court Refuses to Remove RFK Jr. From Swing-State Ballots

description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will argue that a potential second Donald Trump presidency would be one that is steeped in chaos and division, but not focused on Americans’ needs, in a Tuesday evening speech from the National Mall.
title: Harris to Cast Trump as Chaotic, Divisive in Speech at Jan. 6 Site

description: A new US antitrust rule requiring companies to give the government more information on their mergers and acquisitions came with a surprise twist: The Federal Trade Commission passed it with a rare 5-0 vote.
title: FTC’s New Merger Rules Came from Rare, Bipartisan Compromise in Washington

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan dives into what population growth in North Carolina means for the political map there.
title: North Carolina’s Booming Suburbs Point to a Political Shift

description: Ukraine should strike North Korean troops if they enter the country to fight alongside Russia, President Joe Biden said, as officials warned the soldiers are expected to move closer to the front line over the next few weeks.
title: Kyiv Should Strike North Koreans If They Fight in Ukraine, Biden Says

description: Indian Home Affairs Minister Amit Shah authorized a wave of violence across Canada that included extortion and homicides, said a senior Canadian government official.
title: Top Modi Minister Authorized Crimes in Canada, Official Alleges

description: As the candidates for the US presidency work to win over the last undecided voters ahead of a Nov. 5 election that polls suggest will be especially close, one constituency they’ve zeroed in on is Latinos, who make up about 15% of eligible voters, according to a Pew Research Center study. For Republican Donald Trump, the focus went awry when a comedian at an Oct. 27 rally for him insulted Puerto Ricans, the second-largest group of Hispanics in the US, calling their place of origin a “floating isl
title: How Puerto Rico Became an Issue in the US Presidential Election

description: Mozambican opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane, who was declared the runner-up in this month’s disputed presidential election, called for a week-long strike and demonstrations from Oct. 31.
title: Mozambique Opposition Head Calls for Week-Long National Shutdown

description: Raiffeisen Bank International AG slashed the volume of its Russian loans and deposits by about a quarter, after the European Central Bank demanded the lender cut its exposure in the country.
title: Raiffeisen Slashes Russia Loans, Deposits Due to ECB Pressure

description: Somalia ordered an Ethiopian envoy to leave within 72 hours amid growing tensions between the neighboring countries.
title: Somalia Expels Ethiopian Diplomat Amid Dispute Over Port Plans

description: Conspiracy theorists who believe Donald Trump won the 2020 US election are making plans online to monitor and film polling places in US swing states, an effort that civil rights groups say risks suppressing voter turnout.
title: Election Deniers Use Telegram to Rally Poll Watchers in Swing States

description: The UK minimum wage will rise by an inflation-busting 6.7% next year, an increase that helps Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves argue working people are protected at Wednesday’s budget, but may complicate the Bank of England’s inflation fight.
title: UK Minimum Wage to Rise by 6.7% Next Year, Exceeding Inflation

description: A lobbyist who worked closely with Rachel Reeves during this year’s general election campaign has facilitated high-level UK government access for Donald Tang, the head of Chinese fast-fashion firm Shein which is considering a listing on the London Stock Exchange, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Reeves Campaign Adviser Helps Shein’s Tang Get Treasury Access

description: South Africa’s government raised its offer for salary increases to the country’s public servants to 4.7%, well short of a demand by labor unions representing 1.3 million state workers.
title: South African Government Raises Civil-Servant Pay Offer to 4.7%

description: The European Union will impose higher tariffs peaking at 45% on electric vehicles from China, ratcheting up trade tensions between the world’s leading export powers.
title: EU Presses Ahead With Tariffs on China EVs, Risking Retaliation

description: In the clearest sign yet of a truce between Argentina and Spain, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez named a new ambassador to the country Tuesday, after ties with President Javier Milei turned so rocky Spain pulled its top diplomat from the country.
title: Spain Taps New Envoy to Argentina to Defuse Milei-Sanchez Spat

description: Kenya’s Supreme Court ruled that a set of tax measures introduced in the 2023 budget wasn’t entirely unlawful, throwing a lifeline to President William Ruto’s government that’s struggling to make ends meet.
title: Kenya’s Supreme Court Gives Ruto Some Respite in Tax-Law Ruling

description: Judges are rushing to clear a final wave of time-sensitive fights over how Americans will vote in the November election, with US courts fielding one new lawsuit per day on average this month.
title: Election Lawsuits Were Filed at a Rate of One Per Day in October

description: Former President Donald Trump is hosting reporters at his Mar-a-Lago estate on Tuesday morning, where he’ll look to offer a prebuttal of Vice President Kamala Harris’ major address from the National Mall later in the evening.
title: Trump to Prebut Harris Ellipse Speech, Biden to Unveil Ports Aid

description: The US and Taiwan will begin negotiations on addressing double taxation issues, paving the way for a deal that could reduce hurdles for businesses and boost investment in the semiconductor industry.
title: US, Taiwan to Begin Talks on a Deal to Address Double Taxation

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin oversaw strategic nuclear drills a week before the US presidential elections, boasting of improved capabilities that can penetrate air defenses.
title: Putin Oversees Strategic Nuclear Drills Days Before US Election

description: French President Emmanuel Macron looked to smooth often-strained relations with Morocco in a visit to the former protectorate that included signing deal potentially worth up to €10 billion.
title: Macron Hits Reset With Morocco as France Signs Billions in Deals

description: The increase took flows to their highest in a month
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Advance for Second Consecutive Week

description: Dustin Moskovitz gave $30 million to Kamala Harris’ campaign. Reed Hastings donated nearly $7 million. And Ben Horowitz gave $2.5 million to a super PAC that supports the Democratic candidate, just three months after he said he would back Donald Trump.
title: Kamala Harris’ Tech Embrace Halts Trump Tide and Fills War Chest

description: Rachel Reeves has set herself the seemingly contradictory tasks of ending austerity in public services, boosting growth and delivering fiscal stability to reassure markets that Labour can be trusted with the UK’s finances.
title: What to Look for in Rachel Reeves’ Tax-Raising UK Budget

description: Will Hurd, a former CIA undercover officer who went on to win election as a Texas congressman, is joining defense startup Chaos Industries.
title: CIA-Vet-Turned-Congressman Joins Lonsdale-Backed Defense Startup

description: Finnish President Alexander Stubb raised “Russian aggression” with Chinese President Xi Jinping, a rare instance of Beijing coming under public pressure for its support of Moscow.
title: Finnish Leader Raises ‘Russian Aggression’ With China’s Xi

description: Australia will invest A$21 billion ($14 billion) over a decade to ramp up domestic missile and munitions manufacturing, in the latest step by the center-left Labor government to develop a long-range strike capability in the face of a regional arms race.
title: Australia Unveils $14 Billion Plan for Local Missile Production

description: In the early days of Javier Milei’s presidency, Volkswagen AG’s South America chief wasn’t too happy with him. Now he’s part of a chorus of business leaders feeling encouraged about Argentina for the first time in years.
title: Milei’s Revamp Offers CEOs a Glimmer of Optimism About Argentina

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba may find that the price for securing the support of a small opposition party and hanging on to power after a major election setback is to offer part-time workers a tax break.
title: Potential Kingmaker for Japan Ishiba Wants Worker Tax Breaks

description: Italy plans to move about €4.6 billion ($5 billion) originally earmarked for its embattled auto industry toward a business that currently has better prospects: defense.
title: Italy Shifts €4.6 Billion Earmarked for Auto Sector to Defense

description: Friday’s employment report is the last the Federal Reserve will see before its policy meeting next week. But the data will be tough to parse.
title: Storms and Strike Will Complicate Last Jobs Report Before Fed Meeting, Election

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: North Korea Joining Putin’s War in Ukraine Gives Xi a Headache

description: Presidential election could be decided in the fast-growing suburbs of the Tar Heel State — where Democrats are working for a flip but are wary of pinning their hopes on newcomers
title: Booming Suburbs of North Carolina Are Changing the Election Map

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Georgia’s disputed parliamentary elections were free and democratic as he urged the government to ignore criticism from his European Union counterparts.
title: Orban Tells Georgia Government to Ignore EU’s Election Criticism

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy held a phone conversation with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol amid growing concerns that North Korean troops and generals are being dispatched to Russia to aid Moscow’s war on Ukraine.
title: Ukraine, S. Korea to Exchange Intelligence Data, Zelenskiy Says

description: The Indian government will impose penalties on General Electric Co. for severe delays in the delivery of jet engines that power the country’s light-combat aircraft, according to an Indian official with knowledge of the matter.
title: India to Slap Penalties on GE Over Fighter Jet Engines Delay

description: Croatia announced plans to provide Ukraine with dozens of tanks and military vehicles in a deal to modernize the nation’s army that will see it buy new battle tanks from Germany at a reduced price.
title: Croatia Offers Ukraine Tanks, Military Vehicles in Germany Deal

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will make her closing argument Tuesday night from Washington’s historic National Mall, looking to cast former President Donald Trump as a man consumed by grievance and retribution in the hope that Americans will prove willing to turn the page.
title: Harris Prepares Closing Pitch Focused on Jan. 6, Economy

description: Lebanese militant group Hezbollah has announced that Naim Qasem will become its new leader, replacing Hassan Nasrallah, who Israel assassinated just over a month ago.
title: Hezbollah Names Replacement For Assassinated Leader Nasrallah

description: Mozambican law-enforcement officials opened a criminal case against opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane after his supporters torched a police station in the wake of violent protests over claims of fraud in the Oct. 9 elections.
title: Mozambique Police Open Case Against Opposition Head After Clash

description: Giorgia Meloni’s candidate for the governorship of the Liguria region has won the election by a narrow margin, strengthening the Italian premier’s government as it tries to weather ongoing turbulence.
title: Meloni Gets Boost From Candidate’s Win in Liguria Governor Race

description: Battle lines are being drawn as the government decides if it will split power pricing across regions.
title: UK’s Energy Industry Divided in Battle for Free Electricity

description: Germany’s ruling coalition is still in power, but the three-party alliance currently exists in little more than name.
title: Germany’s Ruling Coalition May Have Already Quietly Quit

description: Liberal Democratic Party heavyweight Akira Amari’s defeat in Japan’s general election removes from parliament one of the chip sector’s biggest advocates as concerns grow over the amount of taxpayer money getting plowed into the industry.
title: Japan’s Chip Push Loses Key Advocate After Election Defeat

description: DANBURY, Conn. (AP) — Longtime Donald Trump ally Steve Bannon was released from prison early Tuesday, after serving a four-month sentence for defying a subpoena in the congressional investigation into the  U.S. Capitol attack on Jan. 6, 2021.
title: Trump Ally Bannon Released After Four Months in Prison for Contempt of Congress

description: The Inflation Reduction Act restored American manufacturing jobs – and gave China an opportunity to extend its dominance in some clean energy technologies.
title: How American Tax Breaks Brought a Chinese Solar Energy Giant to Ohio

description: Hitesh Chimanlal Doshi started dabbling in India’s energy sector in 1985 using a 5,000 rupees ($60) loan from a relative.
title: Tycoon Who Began With $60 Is Now Worth $5 Billion on India IPO

description: The Australian government’s failure to rapidly procure and roll out vaccines during Covid-19 lengthened community lockdowns and cost the economy billions, an official inquiry into the nation’s response to the pandemic has found.
title: Australia’s Vaccine Rollout Delay Cost $20 Billion, Report Finds

description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad was officially discharged from the National Heart Institute in Kuala Lumpur on Monday, according to his spokesman, Sufi Yusoff.
title: Malaysia’s Ex-PM Mahathir Discharged From Hospital, Aide Says

description: North Korea sent its foreign minister to Russia for her third trip in less than a year just as its troops arrived in Russia’s Kursk region near the border with Ukraine, a move that NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte described as a “significant escalation” in the two-and-half year old conflict.
title: North Korean Envoy Visits Russia as Troops Approach Ukraine

description: Japan risks entering a renewed phase of policy stasis just as the world prepares for the possible return of Donald Trump to the White House — and the pressure that would bring on key US allies.
title: Japan Risks Turning Inward Just as World Braces for Trump Return

description: Voters in British Columbia elected the New Democratic Party by a wafer-thin majority, giving the progressive party that has ruled the Canadian province since 2017 a chance to cling onto power with a diminished mandate.
title: Trudeau Ally Set to Clinch BC Majority by Razor-Thin Margin
